data.enText: to help sb remember sth, especially sth important that they must do

data.chText: 对不起，我忘了你的名字。提醒我一下好吗？
data.enText: I'm sorry, I've forgotten your name. Can you remind me?

data.chText: 这倒提醒了我，我得带上一些现金。
data.enText: That (= what you have just said, done, etc.) reminds me , I must get some cash.
‘You need to finish that essay.’ ‘ Don't remind me (= I don't want to think about it) .’

data.chText: “别忘了带相机。”“到时候再提醒我一下。”
data.enText: ‘Don't forget the camera.’ ‘Remind me about it nearer the time.’

data.chText: 提醒我在出去之前给艾伦打电话。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: Remind me to phone Alan before I go out.

data.chText: 旅客们请注意，本次列车禁止吸烟。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: Passengers are reminded (that) no smoking is allowed on this train.

data.chText: 请谁告诉我下一步该做什么好不好？
data.enText: Can someone remind me what I should do next?

data.chText: 他提醒她道：“你出过一次事故了。”

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+直接引语

data.enText: ‘You had an accident,’ he reminded her.

data.chText: 使想起（类似的人、地方、事物等）
data.enText: if sb/sth reminds you of sb/sth else, they make you remember or think about the other person, place, thing, etc. because they are similar in some way

data.chText: 你说这样的话，使我想起了你的父亲。
data.enText: You remind me of your father when you say that.

data.chText: 这股气味使我想起了法国。
data.enText: That smell reminds me of France.

data.chText: 使想起（类似的人、地方、事物等）
data.enText: if sb/sth reminds you of sb/sth else, they make you remember or think about the other person, place, thing, etc. because they are similar in some way

data.chText: 你说这样的话，使我想起了你的父亲。
data.enText: You remind me of your father when you say that.

data.chText: 这股气味使我想起了法国。
data.enText: That smell reminds me of France.

tr: put in the mind of someone
assist (somebody acting or reciting) by suggesting the next words of something forgotten or imperfectly learned

value.def: If someone reminds you of a fact or event that you already know about, they say something which makes you think about it.

example.ex: So she simply welcomed him and reminded him of the last time they had met...
example.tran: 于是她只是对他表示欢迎，并且提醒说他们上次见过面。

example.ex: I had to remind myself that being confident is not the same as being perfect!
example.tran: 我得提醒自己表现得自信和表现得完美并不是一回事！

value.def: You use remind in expressions such as Let me remind you that and May I remind you that to introduce a piece of information that you want to emphasize. It may be something that the hearer already knows about or a new piece of information. Sometimes these expressions can sound unfriendly.

example.ex: 'Let me remind you,' said Marianne, 'that Manchester is also my home town.'...
example.tran: “让我来提醒你，”玛丽安娜说，“曼彻斯特也是我的家乡。”

example.ex: May I remind you that the care of your health is a religious duty...
example.tran: 我可以提醒你呵护自己的健康是一项宗教责任吗？

example.ex: Need I remind you who the enemy is?
example.tran: 还需要我来提醒你敌人是谁吗？

value.tran: 让我提醒你…/我能提醒你…

value.def: If someone reminds you to do a particular thing, they say something which makes you remember to do it.

example.ex: Can you remind me to buy a bottle of Martini?...
example.tran: 你能提醒我买一瓶马提尼酒吗？

example.ex: The note was to remind him about something he had to explain to one of his students.
example.tran: 这张字条是要提醒他得向他的一个学生解释某件事情。

value.tran: 提醒(某人做某事);使想起(做某事)

value.def: If you say that someone or something reminds you of another person or thing, you mean that they are similar to the other person or thing and that they make you think about them.

example.ex: She reminds me of the wife of the pilot who used to work for you...
example.tran: 她让我想到过去为你工作的飞行员的妻子。

example.ex: This reminds me of Christmas parties.

queryExplainVideo.detail: Remember vs remind 的含义和用法
